newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai baht, interbank rate down in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Thai baht, interbank rate down in late trade.

text.p: The baht eased against the dollar in late trade on Wednesday on the U.S. unit's strength abroad, dealers said.
The baht fell to 26.020/26.030 to the dollar late from 26.003/26.006 in early morning trade, dealers said.
Plentiful liquidity and low short-term baht interest rates also helped boost demand for the dollar, dealers said.
"The dollar buying will continue tomorrow. The dollar is very bullish abroad, while liquidity remained ample," said one dealer at a foreign bank.
The Bank of Thailand fixed the mid-rate at 25.99 per dollar against 25.96 on Tuesday.
The overnight interbank rate fell to 7.00 percent near the close from 8.00-8.50 percent early on the gradual entry of the state provident and pension fund into the market.
The one-month baht/dollar swap premium was quoted at 6.50/7.50 satangs per dollar late compared with 7.50/8.50 in the morning.
